page.title: 16A VIEW FROM A CLASSROOM
page.content: We have a fantastic view from our classroom. We can see all of Kewstoke, Sand Bay and Sand Point. We can also see part of the Bristol Channel, which is a sort of greeny brown colour. Behind Sand Point we can see Wales. I can see factory chimneys. We can also see many fields out of the classroom window. There are about 100 of them and they are all different colours, with hedges which separate them. We can see Woodspring Priory in the distance and it does not look very big. There is a lot of cattle in the fields. The cows are Fresians. We can see Elmsley Nursery, a white house, where eggs and milk can be bought.
